Well, rapping about gangs, money, hoes, etc. Gets annoying and very repetitive. I agree with Taharok, I can have tolerance for the rappers who rap for a purpose, with a meaning, for good. Not the ones like “Soulja boy.”
[/quote]
Tico* :P[/quote]

Yeah, lol.

zoltanman:

Well, rapping about gangs, money, hoes, etc. Gets annoying and very repetitive. I agree with Taharok, I can have tolerance for the rappers who rap for a purpose, with a meaning, for good. Not the ones like “Soulja boy.”

item.title: Rock vs. Rap
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

[quote=“ThugLife, post:35, topic:162264”][quote author=Tico135 link=topic=220693.msg2021016#msg2021016 date=1201597982]
Personally I prefer rock. Sure it’s changed over the years, but it was good then, and is good now. Rap is ok… but after a while I have no tolerance for the constant swearing and singing about death, etc. I think the lyrics really make a difference on my opinion, if the lyrics are talking about something meaningful that has nothing to do with gangs and shooting and such, I have more tolerance for it.

But most Rap-Rock bands (potentially like Linkin Park and such) I like because they usually aren’t talking about the things I listed above.
[/quote]
There is ways of making rapping about guns, death and gangs and making it good.[/quote]

True, however I wouldn’t be an overall fan of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Rock vs. Rap
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Personally I prefer rock. Sure it’s changed over the years, but it was good then, and is good now. Rap is ok… but after a while I have no tolerance for the constant swearing and singing about death, etc. I think the lyrics really make a difference on my opinion, if the lyrics are talking about something meaningful that has nothing to do with gangs and shooting and such, I have more tolerance for it.

But most Rap-Rock bands (potentially like Linkin Park and such) I like because they usually aren’t talking about the things I listed above.

item.title: Rock vs. Rap
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

Well, it’s depends on the person’s opinion. I personally like rock in my opinion. I love rap also, but the modern rap today is just the same lyrics over and over again. It’s about money, gangs, hoods/ghettos, and hoes. I love some rappers, who write lyrics that mean something and make a difference. Like the rapper Common for example, read his lyrics, they’re different and it’s about making a difference. Same for rock, the lyrics can be confusing, but a lot of it is good. Like I said, it’s a matter of opinion, they both have their negatives and positives.

Read full topic

I remember first the popular song was black eye pee’s what ever it was called song…
then it was something else… then it was ghetto gospel then it was riding dirty…
now its this…[/quote]

item.title: Rock vs. Rap
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Its a matter of opinion, no one can say whats better or not, because of the fact neither is better than the other. Different people like different music. People who like rock are bound to say it is better than rap just like people who like rap will say it is better than rock.

Read full topic
